author: labatts
message: This is really nice! Keep up the good work (but take a break for the holidays =])

author: Stavallo
message: Wow, excellent job! Thank you very much!

author: lunarcloud
message: I'm coming from KDE planet. What is homerun (dislikes release announcements that are devoid of a basic explanation of product)?

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message: Oh right, I don't like those as well. Homerun is a KDE launcher. Just added a link to its homepage.

author: Ingolf Schaefer
message: I really like Homerun and use it as default starter now. :-) One thing is a bit annoying tough, why can't I change to the different "tabs" via keyboard? I seem to be unable to change from "Home" to "Applications"  with keys. Is there a keybinding not working for me?

author: baxeico
message: Just downloaded the tar.bz. Extracted, configured with CMake, compiled and installed (make install on /usr/local). I don't see homerun in Plasma Widget, what I have to do to use it? I already tried to logout and login again. Thank you for help!

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message: Assuming KDE is installed in /usr, you must run cmake with: -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=/usr. Otherwise Plasma won't find Homerun.

replies.author: Guest
replies.message: Can't you simply set the proper KDEDIRS env var and run kbuildsycoca4 - just like for other plugins?

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message: I have never used this method since I build KDE in my home, but this sounds like a better alternative to installing in /usr.

replies.author: Xu Wai
replies.message:
but it'll be implemented, yes?

also Happy holidays!

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message: Yes, I'd like to add this. You may want to file a bug so that it's not forgotten.
